items.name: ABN AMRO tree planting event at Mariënwaerdt

fields.event-name: ABN AMRO tree planting event at Mariënwaerdt
fields.event_details: Squally rain and loads of mud didn't stop ABN Amro, plus teams from Life Terra and Land Life Company. from planting [500?] trees at the Mariënwaerdt estate at the end of November! The challenging conditions brought out the best in everyone, and the volume of mud was often hilarious. Nobody went home clean, but they did go home happy, refreshed and satisfied by a bracing day of tree planting and the renewal of woodland devastated by Ash Dieback. Congratulations and thank you, ABN Amro!

items.name: Planting trees with Tulpenrallye at Mariënwaerdt

fields.event-name: Planting trees with Tulpenrallye at Mariënwaerdt
fields.event_details:
On a crisp November morning under a bright sun, members of Tulpenrallye joined the Life Terra team in the field to plant trees at Mariënwaerdt estate. In the days up to the planting event it had rained heavily, so the participants had to deal with a muddy field with large puddles of water and ice and hardened soil here and there. They weren’t phased by these tough conditions and managed to plant around 250 trees! Thank you members of Tulpenrallye, for this amazing effort that helps this part of the Mariënwaerdt estate recover from Ash Dieback disease.

Tulpenrallye, organiser of the Dutch annual car rally event of the same name, is planting a total of 3,500 trees in partnership with Life Terra, to offset all CO2 emissions from the 70th edition.

items.name: Afternoon tree planting event with EY

fields.event-name: Afternoon tree planting event with EY
fields.event_details: Two teams from EY joined us on one day in late November at the Mariënwaerdt Estate to replant a forest that had been destroyed by Ash Dieback disease. In contrast to the week of rain preceding it, the day dawned bright and clear and it was a pleasure to be out in nature, in winter sunshine, backdropped by birdsong. The EY teams together planted [1000?] young trees, which are now standing in neat rows where previously just stumps and scrub existed. In just a few years, these will mature into an enchanting and hardy mixed woodland, bursting with biodiversity. Thank you EY and we look forward to planting with you again soon!

items.name: Agora Portals International School planting tree day!!

fields.event-name: Agora Portals International School planting tree day!!
fields.event_details:
Today, our two classes of 5-year-old students arrived at the designated planting area near the entrance of our school, so we expect them to show their parents and show them their tree.

They were thrilled to see our gardener, Juanma, prepared with the trees, soil, gloves, shovels, watering cans, and everything needed for the planting activity.

Once there, we asked the children why trees are so important and what they need to live. A variety of enthusiastic answers emerged: “They need water,” “They give us fruit”, “They don’t like plastic,” and “They clean the air.”

After this discussion, all the students helped Juanma by adding soil around the trees and stamping the ground to keep it firm. Some even picked up bits of litter they found nearby, proudly declaring that the trees wouldn’t like that. It was a wonderful day of learning and teamwork, and we can’t wait to watch our trees grow!

What a day to remember! Life Terra hosted our first tree-planting event with NVIDIA near Munich! They support this plot with 1,000 new trees — a big thank you to NVIDIA for taking steps towards climate action and a greener future. Together we planted 200 trees and set up proper protectors around them.

Thanks to a fantastic fundraising campaign, NVIDIANs joined us for an incredible day in the forest, combining nature, teamwork, and a dose of wellbeing. From boosting mental health to building stronger connections with colleagues, this event truly had it all.

Welcome, NVIDIA, to the Life Terra family as our newest business supporter for climate action! Let’s keep growing together.

items.name: Kicking off the planting season in Limburg with BLG!

This project close to the village of Oeffelt was organised by Maasheggen Mooi. This is an initiative by Lars van Peij, who has sadly been diagnosed with Huntington disease. items.name: Ecological restoration continues in Santa Clara a Velha

fields.event-name: Ecological restoration continues in Santa Clara a Velha
fields.event_details:
The Santa Clara a Velha Ecological Restoration project is Life Terra's biggest project in Portugal, with more than 65 ha restored using 7 different species.

This project aims to restore a former exhausted eucalyptus monoculture and transform the land into a biodiverse food forest. This will allow for soil recovery, natural regeneration, defragmentation of the habitat, and it will also produce fruit and pine nuts for the landowner as a form of revenue.

Furthermore, this project is certified for carbon removal and biodiversity credits, and this winter's plantation aimed to plant 7.500 plants as a way to make up for the mortality of the previous years.

This area suffers from intense droughts in summer, and the previous exhausted soils and the presence of wild boars makes the planting of new saplings in the first years a necessity in order to achieve our restoration goal. This shows that Life Terra's commitment to ecological restoration is a long-term view.

La actividad ha sido una experiencia muy enriquecedora. Además, ha estado vinculada a nuestro proyecto de innovación, en el que pretendemos repoblar una zona en la que teníamos muy poquita vegetación. Las familias y el profesorado se han implicado mucho, y los alumnos/as han valorado positivamente la actividad.

items.name: Creating a Woven Hedge at Boerderij Hartstocht near Abcoude

fields.event-name: Creating a Woven Hedge at Boerderij Hartstocht near Abcoude
fields.event_details: Chilly Dutch weather didn't deter a strong, hardy group of mariners and ship engineers during Reederei Nord's woven hedge planting event in Abcoude on 11th December! The group made swift progress along a 600m stretch of farmland, and soon the beginnings of the hedge were clear to see. We can't wait to see - and to share - how this hedge evolves to become a haven for local biodiversity, as well as a delicious source of fresh berries for local ramblers!

Our group helped the local nature association to plant this hedge in an agricultural area where biodiversity is usually very low. Children, adults, parents, friends and elderly people joined forces and planted these shrubs with a lot of fun and in record time!

La actividad finalmente fue muy, pero que muy bien. Al comienzo tuvimos algunos problemas logísiticos, como falta de herramientas, o que el ayuntamiento nos llevó albarrobos en lugar de encinas. Por tanto, las especies que etiquetamos como "desconocidas" son todas algarrobo. Esperamos poder arreglarlo posteriormente.

Operarios del servicio de jardinería nos llevaron a media mañana más herramientas para poder avanzar más rápido y al día siguiente fueron a poner puntos de goteo a todos los árboles plantados.

Por otro lado, los alumnos/as que parecían desmotivados se vinieron arriba y no había quien los parara (algunos no querían parar para desayunar) y siguieron plantando hasta el último segundo.

La zona en la que hemos hecho la reforestación era una antigua escombrera, transformada en zona verde del pueblo, junto a un ermita. En varias ocasiones desde el ayuntamiento han intentado ajardinar esa zona sin mucho éxito. Tras el análisis que hicimos desde el centro vimos que uno de los principales problemas era la densidad de conejo de campo en esa zona, por lo que decidimos poner protectores metálicos a todos los árboles.

Algunas propuestas de mejora son una mejor coordinación con la concejalía de jardines para el préstamo de herramientas, poder etiquetar plantas en la app con su nombre aunque no estuvieran en la lista prevista, y enterrar mejor los protectores metálicos que pusimos (ya que quedaron un poco endebles).

Queremos hacer un vídeo-resumen de la actividad pero por ahora no hemos tenido tiempo, te paso el enlace a la carpeta con fotos y vídeos del evento. https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1tbn_BEKh4HFryLa_Gh29h7OkFgBmC6_P?usp=sharing

Si hay publicación agradeceríamos que se etiquete al Ayuntamiento de Águilas y al IES Europa.

Muchas gracias

items.name: Planting with the Green Helmets Project in Las Rozas

fields.event-name: Planting with the Green Helmets Project in Las Rozas
fields.event_details:
On Thursday 21 November, Cascos Verdes (Green Helmets) and employees from Amazon and Amazon Web Services gathered in Las Rozas, Madrid, to plant 150 trees and shrubs to restore the Dehesa de Navalcarbón.

The planting took place alongside a local school, Colegio Zola, where employees and students learned not only about planting but also about local species and the importance of caring for the environment.

The Green Helmets initiative aims to reforest and carry out work to improve the forest environment after the 2021 fires in Andalusia, south of Spain. Now, they are also expanding their reforestation efforts across the country.

We enjoyed the enthusiasm and energy of the Amazon employees, who, divided into groups, did amazing work hand in hand with the students.

At the end of the activity, and because we still had some time left, participants also learned about an insect hotel that is placed next to the planting site, which will help to attract pollinators and foster a healthier ecosystem around it.

We hope this will be the first of many collaborations!

items.name: Planting in The Green Rebel Farm with College Hageveld

fields.event-name: Planting in The Green Rebel Farm with College Hageveld
fields.event_details:
The planting activity at The Green Rebel farm in Miravet was an inspiring and hands-on experience for everyone involved. Over the five-day event, 24 students from College Hageveld, accompanied by three teachers, planted 200 trees in Hageveld’s Foodforest, continuing their tradition of planting one tree for each graduating student. The students worked enthusiastically, learning about regenerative agroforestry practices while preparing the soil with biochar, sowing fava beans, and adding mulch and cover crops to ensure the trees thrive in the challenging Mediterranean conditions.

The atmosphere was vibrant, with students enjoying the process of planting and gaining a deeper understanding of how these actions contribute to combating climate change. The weather was cooperative, with sunny days making the work enjoyable. In addition to planting, the group bonded over shared meals they prepared with fresh produce harvested from the farm, creating a strong connection to the land and to each other. This event not only added 200 more trees to the food forest but also planted seeds of awareness and hope in the minds of young people, empowering them to take action for a sustainable future.

The new Avenue of Freedom was established on Saturday, November 9th, in the Broumov region, where persecution of clergy from all over Czechoslovakia was concentrated during the previous communist regime. In the 1950s, an internment camp for priests and monks from various orders was set up in the local Benedictine monastery. By planting the Avenue of Freedom, we commemorated the past and expressed our respect for those who suffered and fought for our freedom.

The event is organized within the project „Planting Our Future”, supported by the International Visegrad Fund. Its aim is to exchange knowledge and experience in the field of tree planting and tree care programs in Poland, the Czech Republic and Slovakia.

Project partners: Fundusz Partnerstwa, Klub Gaja (Poland), Nadace Partnerství (Czechia), Nadácia Ekopolis (Slovakia).

The planting of the Avenue of Freedom takes place as part of the European Tree Planting Day initiative, which aims to unite communities, schools and environmental organisations across Europe to plant trees.

Initiative partners: Life Terra Foundation (Netherlands), Nadace Partnerství (Czechia).

“Lab Aberto fosters creativity and technological innovation in schools by establishing specialized laboratories. In these spaces, students build flying wings, autonomous cars and boats, and create objects using 3D printers with a variety of materials. Lab Aberto prepares students for the technological challenges of the future by engaging them in the artificial universe. However, Lab Aberto and its partner, Life Terra, believe that this admirable artificial world of the future will be even better when it is synergistically aligned with human nature and ecological sustainability.

On November 30th, the event began in the laboratory, with its coordinator, António Gonçalves, explaining the initiative and its objectives. Following this, 25 volunteers sowed cork oak acorns into small ceramic pots produced with a 3D printer. These seedlings will grow into saplings to be planted next year. Clara Araújo, representing ALTRI Florestal, and Renato Ferreira from the Municipality of Torres Vedras explained the entire process.

After the sowing activity, we moved to the field to plant strawberry trees. Lab Aberto aims to work increasingly at the intersection of forestry and technology. ALTRI, the Municipality of Torres Vedras, and Life Terra will continue to collaborate with Lab Aberto, and in a year, our cork oak saplings will be ready for planting.”

fields.event_details:
Behind the Hartstocht farm in Abcoude, together with the Grond Verbond foundation, we are going to construct a woven hedge along the boundary path. Woven hedges have been around for a long time and were widely used as field fencing in the past. The hedges consist of small trees and shrubs, often with spines or thorns, woven together to provide a strong fence. We plant the different varieties in random order and after growing out for 5-6 years, the trees are braided and pruned, creating a natural hedge of between 1.5 and 2 meters high. At this farm, cows walking along on both sides of the hedge will do most of the pruning, making the hedge increasingly full and more attractive to insects and birds. A wicker hedge is an important addition to countryside biodiversity!

During this event we have invited multiple of our partners. This will not only give them the opportunity to connect with nature, but also connect to other organisations and people in their sector.

Como parte de los preparativos, los estudiantes aprendieron a identificar especies nativas adecuadas para el terreno de su escuela y sus alrededores. Utilizando aplicaciones como Pl@ntNet y consultando herramientas digitales como ARCGIS, seleccionaron cuidadosamente árboles adaptados al clima local evitando especies invasoras y considerando aquellas en peligro de extinción.

La actividad comenzó con dinámicas grupales que motivaron a los alumnos a reflexionar sobre el cambio climático y cómo sus acciones pueden contribuir al cuidado del medio ambiente. Tras la explicación teórica y demostración práctica realizada por los docentes, los estudiantes se dividieron en grupos pequeños para llevar a cabo la plantación. Equipados con palas y azadones, plantaron cuidadosamente los árboles (castaño, nogal, granado y níspero) siguiendo las instrucciones para asegurar su correcto crecimiento.

Para garantizar el seguimiento de los árboles plantados, cada ejemplar fue etiquetado utilizando la plataforma Life Terra. Los estudiantes registraron datos sobre las especies y ubicaciones mediante smartphones, integrándolos en el mapa global de Life Terra.

During this green holiday, thousands of pupils throughout the Netherlands left their classrooms and went into their residential areas or nature to plant trees.

Donné Slangen, Director-General of Nature and Fisheries of the Ministry of Agriculture, Fisheries, Food Security and Nature confirmed later that day the importance of nature education for all children. Together with a number of children, he planted a tree in the Ruinen forestry in the municipality of De Wolden (Drenthe). In doing so, he and all the other planters became, according to columnist Marcel van Ool, advisor on landscape and cultural history of Staatsbosbeheer, 'part of a miracle'.

The idea that citizens should be involved in rewilding processes is the central idea of the Life Terra project. This is also the central idea of the event to be held on December 10th at Quinta da Penha Longa, where residents together with the company's employees will, once again, participate directly in the planting operations of native species included in the rewilding program. This event will have the support of Cascais Ambiente, the environment agency of the Cascais municipality

The Caesar Park’s transformative idea that the natural value of the forest space is an important dimension of the resort's quality, justifying relevant investments in its conservation, is also strongly associated with Life Terra's objectives and action in multiple areas in Europe.

¡Impresionante esfuerzo por parte de los voluntarios y las voluntarias de Saeta Yield!

fields.event_details: El área de La Sagra presenta características propias de un ecosistema mediterráneo degradado, con suelos erosionados y escasez de cobertura arbórea. Este proyecto busca reconstruir un mosaico de vegetación característico de esta zona, combinando arbustos y árboles que imiten la estructura de un bosque abierto. Este tipo de hábitat es ideal para especies de fauna como conejos, aves insectívoras y pequeños reptiles, que contribuyen a mantener el equilibrio ecológico.

items.name: Planting of virtually user-purchased trees in Radomyśl

fields.event-name: Planting of virtually user-purchased trees in Radomyśl
fields.event_details:
We are happy to announce that the trees “planted” virtually through the Czas na Las website are taking root in reality! Thanks to your commitment, seedlings are already growing in the Radomyśl nad Sanem.

1,375 trees native to Poland have been planted. The planting began in the early morning hours in Radomyśl. Trees were funded virtually, through the website czasnalas.pl. After a few hours of planting, the tree planters went on a lunch break. After lunch, they protected the trees from possible gnawing by animals. The planting was completed in the evening, and Poland has become greener. The species biodiversity of Polish forests has also increased.

Also YOU can plant a virtual tree thanks to the website “https://czasnalas.org/”

fields.event-name: Middagboom planten met Politie Oost Nederland bij Klarenbeek

fields.event_details: El coordinador medioambiental del centro organizara la plantación con las tutorías interesadas.

La retama, resistente a la sequía, favorece la fijación de nutrientes y proporciona refugio a la fauna local, mientras que la encina, uno de los árboles más emblemáticos del bosque mediterráneo, juega un papel crucial en la restauración ecológica. Con su robustez y longevidad, la encina ofrece sombra y alimento a diversas especies, además de ser un elemento fundamental en la fijación de carbono y la regulación del ciclo del agua.

La plantación se llevó a cabo a través de 2 profesores pertenecientes al Programa Ecoescuelas y 22 alumnos/as de la materia de Biología de 1º ESO. La experiencia fue muy gratificante para todos y disfrutaron mucho del proceso de plantación.

LIFE Teixeres tiene por objetivo principal la mejora del estado de conservación y de la capacidad de resiliencia de los bosques mediterráneos de tejo en el ámbito valenciano, ante los efectos adversos del cambio climático
